channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Iconic Brompton bike maker suffers 99% profit decline amid post-COVID bike industry turmoil
item.description: Profits fell to just £4,600 last year as the foldable bike brand fought copycat competitors and falling demand.

item.title: Johnson still on track to be elected speaker despite early setback: bettors
How CEOs spent their bonus money in 2024: ‘I feel like Batman every time I step into my new Tesla Model X’
item.description: Look no further for inspiration on what to buy in the Christmas sales.

item.title: Netflix’s stock is still a sell and looks ‘overvalued in a momentum market’
Carvana father-son duo lose hundreds of millions of dollars in net worth after short-seller report
item.description: A prominent short-seller accused the used-car dealer of wrongdoing, sending its shares down.

item.title: TGI Fridays’ ex-CEO—who introduced sushi to a restaurant chain famous for potato skins and mozzarella sticks—will step up to oversee hundreds of locations post-bankruptcy
item.description: Ray Blanchette served as CEO from 2018 to 2023, a time when Fridays struggled during the pandemic.

item.title: Apple offers rare iPhone discounts in China as foreign smartphone sales drop
Europe stunned the world with its ‘regulatory tsunami’ last year—but AI and Trump will add new snags in 2025
item.description: The EU went after Big Tech in 2024. The new year will add more players to the regulatory tussle, including Donald Trump and Elon Musk.

item.title: Today’s newborns may need $5 million or more for retirement starting in 2100
These analysts aren't worried about Carvana
